metadata.title: The Team Rebellion
metadata.subtitle: Lite
metadata.description: Your team pushes back — openly. Unclear direction, rising tensions, and emerging factions test your influence, clarity, and emotional intelligence under pressure. Your responses reveal how you lead through conflict, regain psychological safety, and rebuild trust.
metadata.hint: Tests Influence, Conflict Mindset, Clarity Mindset, Harmony/Empathy Mindset

dimensions.label: Risk mindset
dimensions.description: How you respond to rising group tension and potential loss of authority.

dimensions.label: Clarity mindset
dimensions.description: How you restore structure under conflict and uncertainty.

dimensions.label: Influence & ownership
dimensions.description: How confidently you take charge of dysfunctional dynamics.

dimensions.label: Harmony & psychological safety
dimensions.description: How you nurture emotional safety while making hard calls.

scenes.label: Scene 1
scenes.title: The Revolt Begins
scenes.body:
Your team suddenly pushes back:

“We’re tired of unclear direction.”

This is the moment where authority, influence, and emotional presence collide.

options.label: B
options.desc: You try to reduce heat by postponing.

options.label: C
options.desc: You read the emotional undercurrent first.

scenes.label: Scene 2
scenes.title: The Ringleader Speaks
scenes.body:
One team member steps forward:

“We need a new approach.”

The room’s energy shifts — eyes turn toward you.
scenes.tip: Your response shapes group power balance.

options.label: A
options.desc: You turn their challenge into collaboration.

options.label: D
options.desc: You take charge with renewed structure.

scenes.label: Scene 3
scenes.title: Tension Spikes
scenes.body: Suddenly, the team splits into two factions — frustration building, voices rising.
scenes.tip: This is the moment influence and conflict mastery truly show.

options.label: A
options.desc: You assert control to stop escalation.

options.label: B
options.desc: You guide them toward shared understanding.

scenes.label: Scene 4
scenes.title: A Quiet Member Cries
scenes.body: Amid heated discussions, you notice someone quietly crying in the corner — overwhelmed, silent, unseen.
scenes.tip: Your leadership here defines team emotional culture.

options.label: A
options.main: Stop the meeting and check on them.

options.label: B
options.desc: You focus exclusively on task and order.

options.label: D
options.desc: You support while maintaining group flow.

scenes.label: Scene 5
scenes.title: The Team Asks for a Vote
scenes.body:
Momentum builds. Someone says the words that change power dynamics:

“Should we decide by majority vote?”
scenes.tip: How you share or retain power defines trust.

options.label: D
options.desc: You elevate the discussion above conflict.

scenes.label: Scene 6
scenes.title: Shadow You Arrives
scenes.body:
A translucent silhouette — your inner opposite — whispers:

“Power or harmony — what will you choose?”
scenes.tip: Your answer reveals your leadership instinct under pressure.

scenes.label: Scene 7
scenes.title: Final Leadership Decision
scenes.body:
Three doors materialize — each glowing with a different leadership philosophy:

SAFE — Go With Majority
SMART — Hybrid Model
BRAVE — Leader Decides
scenes.tip: This final choice reveals your dominant leadership archetype.

options.label: A
options.desc: You maximize harmony and shared ownership.

options.label: C
options.desc: You step into full authority to realign the team.

growthSuggestions.text: You tend to push tasks over emotions. Strengthen psychological safety by naming feelings and checking in proactively.
Your team may struggle without structured thinking. Practice reframing conflict into clear problem statements.
You avoid tension at key moments. Learn to hold discomfort while guiding difficult discussions.
You take bold stances in conflict. Balance this by building more relational buffers.
You show developing influence. Continue building both clarity and emotional presence in tough team dynamics.
